intro: Impatiens wuyiensis, commonly known as the Wuyi impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the Wuyi Mountains in China. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that release seeds when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
